title: @Riot, with Kassadin sitting at a 42.04% win rate...
body:
Are you guys content with how you left him? Out of the majority of the mid laners he has the worst stats. His base stats are laughable, his scaling is mediocre, his ult doesn't even do damage anymore. Is there any word on any plans for him or is he just gonna stay like this? I understand how he an get of out hand easily with his ult but I feel like after nerfing that repeatedly can't you get his basic abilities some love? 

I was thinking increasing the damage on all of them, and no that's not over the top, they're LOW.
Increase the scaling on his shield and let the shield block ALL damage. (Viktor?)
Let Kassadin's abilities proc his e charge twice, even as an anti-mage he loses trades due to the fact that it's rarely up for them. You have to use it when it's up a lot to push the wave due to the lack of wave clear. 


Now the problem with Kassadin was his ult, right? I've seen it time and time again. A champ has a problem, Riot nerfs other things about the champ, then finally nerfs the problem, and leaves the rest of the kit trash and nerfed into the ground. This I feel is exactly what happened to Kassadin. 

What do you guys think?

{{champion:38}}

replies.body: I think kassadin does less damage than a support name until he gets like 3 items.  He's a fun champ to play, but just takes too long to actually scale into something decent.  It's pitiful.

He can't be balanced. He is a high damage champion built around high mobility. They have tried to gate him (mana costs/bad early game), they have tried to nerf his numbers, but at the end of the day the high mobility plus high damage is not something Riot seems to be able to balance. (Personally it's because I don't think Riot forces champions to pay enough for mobility) They will do everything in their power to protect his "identity" (ult jumps) by hitting his other numbers. It's just what they do.
Riven can only get over walls with her 3rd q though, and she generally has to choose Dmg or Mobility. Kass didnt.

Thats frankly untrue. What people dont understand tho is that the eco system of league has drastrically changed and is very very sensitive compared to lets say s1-s2.

For instance: Kassadin has usually bad match ups across the board, but he was a good pick versus Kat and lb. Kassadin silence was removed; so kat and lb's win rate spiked. (LB having actually the same dmg pattern and almost identical mobility than him, just a LOT more dmg all game long) Now, funny enough, kassadin was so bad but still won some games cause of these match ups that--when they nerfed leblanc his win rate actually dropped because the play rate of leblanc dropped hence people would go to better mid champs! The irony. 

Mobility isnt something that you cant balance. Usually mobility means less abilities to do dmg with: a trade off, a counterplay etc...

Kassadin paid in all of the above. (he was the guy who paid the most for his ult than any other champ)

The issue is that perception and actual strength (speculation) is very different and Riot refused at first to change him: but the perception was so intense on him to get gutted that they finally did it.

Back in season 2/3: He was all right. You know what Riot did?

-Nerfed all the picks that challenged him AND that he countered himself. 
-Changed the meta around bruisers, poke and adcs. (means assassins are no longer relevant, leaving him the only alternative)
-Removed Force of Nature.
THEN

-athenes nerfs
-MR items change

There you go, uve got OP champ!

Wanna know something that would make him alright even tho you would give him back the stuff he had before? (base dmg, scaling and silence, dmg on ult) YES I STILL THINK HE SHOULD GET SILENCE.

-buff Athenes MR.
-add tenacity items
-add D.O.T Item other than liandries.

Honestly, Kass just needs his Thematic actually played into. He's always been the anti-mage, a Mage Killer. The thing is, they removed his Mage Killing tool, his Silence, but kept his Tankiness. He's more or less the 'Ignore The Mage Because We're Immune To Magic' champion rather than Mage Killing. Galio and Beigar are the other two Anti-Mages. Veigar is a Mage, Galio is a Tank, Kassadin is an Assassin. Out of all of them, Kassadin is the only one who DOESN'T do additional damage for being an anti-mage. Veigar's R does more based on his opponent's AP and Galio gets Damage for building MR. Kassadin is just the 'I don't take damage from you because screw you.' 

We need something to make Kassadin fit the Mage Killer theme again. He's SUPPOSED to be countered by AD, but in reality, he does about the same against magic damage champs as he does against most AD champs. Maybe give him some damage based on some one's AP or have him pierce MR or give him bonus damage for something mage related about his opponent so he's actually a mage killer, not a Mage Ignorer.

Quite frankly, as much as I hated it, the first proposed incarnation of Kassadin's rework was the best thematically

Passive: Same as old passive. That means taking magic damage increased his attack speed
Q: No shield, still silenced, Base damage down to 200 at max, .5 AP ratio
W: Same as now, but autoattacks had .4 AP ratio instead, base damage increased to 80 at max, and active added 200 base damage and .8 Ratio. Therefore making his W very powerful with a 1.6 AP ratio if used as an AA reset and high base damage
E: Like Q, 200 base damage at max, .6 AP ratio
R: Basically same as ult before gutting the range. Mana scaling and stuff

Quite frankly, this was just fine to me. His W as truly a powerhouse and he felt like a REAL anti-mage like he was originally designed to be. Still able to destroy any mage with his high risk high reward passive and also he had to take the risk of getting up close and personal for assassinations, but it was very rewarding

Now why did it get scrapped? People were like "HOLY SHT THAT W IS OP!!!!!!!!!"
